tweets.text:
@RosieP4 @CmdrSpace @ColneStour @SarahPhillips8 @Nick_Unsworth @jillytooley @paulthoro9ood @joe_crowley @TheGazette @R4BDg @BW_Times @EnvAgency Reminds me of some ‚Äòsuspicions‚Äô I have of the electricity companies handling nuclear ‚ò¢Ô∏è power. 

I ‚Äòwonder‚Äô ü§î if their proposed new solar farms with HUGE battery storage capacity are actually a ‚Äògreenwash‚Äô for gaining planning permissions for substations for handling nuclear? ü§î

@RosieP4 @ExplorerDale @ColneStour @SarahPhillips8 @Nick_Unsworth @jillytooley @paulthoro9ood @joe_crowley @TheGazette @R4BDg @BW_Times @EnvAgency Oh that‚Äôs a bit rubbish. I guess it will end up being a reservoir for water supply as well (with all the building, we need more water). I friend (who works in EA) says we need next three winters with well above average rainfall to refill acquirers, or we will be in trouble.

@ExplorerDale @CmdrSpace @ColneStour @SarahPhillips8 @Nick_Unsworth @jillytooley @paulthoro9ood @joe_crowley @TheGazette @R4BDg @BW_Times @EnvAgency That was abandoned by @EnvAgency in 2016 in favour of the Blackwater Aggregates proposal.   It was a hybrid scheme that was to bring environmental, social and economic benefits.   Small-scale, low-cost projects could/should be undertaken by community in partnership with EA. /

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

tweets.text: @GeorgeMonbiot @Dryad711 Not to mention the complete failure of the regulatory bodies who should have called this out years ago! What was the @EnvAgency doing all this time...?

@ExplorerDale @CmdrSpace @ColneStour @SarahPhillips8 @Nick_Unsworth @jillytooley @paulthoro9ood @joe_crowley @TheGazette @R4BDg @BW_Times Yes, the forces of capitalism are working together and Blackwater Aggregates kindly offered @EnvAgency a 'solution' - if they were allowed to quarry, they'd fund a dam.  All this at ¬£34m to protect only 25 properties from a 1 in 20 year event.  Not even the preferred scheme 1/

Mainstream broadcasters have terribly neglected these issues, with the result that neither the polluters nor the UK's 4 governments are feeling any pressure to stop the death of our beautiful rivers. Bypassing the broadcasters, we'll use a new technique to focus public attention.

We want to create a¬†Nature Recovery Network¬†of bigger, better, more¬†connected spaces across England üå≥
¬†¬†
We'll be working #TogetherForNature with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver¬†#NatureRecovery¬†on the ground.¬†¬†
¬†¬†
Read more:¬†https://t.co/CVOQraktcT https://t.co/pJ7Fwge6FC
@RosieP4 @CmdrSpace @ColneStour @SarahPhillips8 @Nick_Unsworth @jillytooley @paulthoro9ood @joe_crowley @TheGazette @R4BDg @BW_Times Purely for flood control ?!
@ThamesPathNT  between Crcklade and Castle Eaton yesterday.  A wade rather than a walk. https://t.co/a4uaQBdP5Z
@campbellar @CubanMule @DawlishWarrenGC @EnvAgencySW Juvenile males. Who need the hiding of their lives.

This picture by Kaz Sampson @DawlishWarrenGC highlights the fragility of the sea defences at Dawlish Warren. I understand @EnvAgencySW is trying to patch the knife damage but these tubes are filled with sand. If water gets in they quickly become ineffectual. Who would do this ? https://t.co/yrMILHshB8

urls.title: Nature Recovery Network
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We‚Äôd like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. Where we have identified any third party copyright information you will need to obtain permission from the copyright holders concerned. This publication is available at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/nature-recovery-network/nature

tweets.text:
Work to encourage channel avulsion on Swindale beck finally crosses tipping point. Recent floods have started an avulsion creating 5 hectares of anastomosing wetland. Minor intervention and patience have eventually paid off!
@RSPBEngland @EnvAgencyNW @SalfordScience @SalfordHydro https://t.co/biaKE3rFDA

Please avoid the foot / cycle path alongside of the River Ouse in York upstream, river left of Scarborough Bridge to allow the @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyYNE to do some preparation work for improving flood defences in the area. https://t.co/cqYbMFGoVG

As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlanet with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver the Nature Recovery Network and create better connected spaces for nature üåø https://t.co/e6wIperqa2

@campbellar @DawlishWarrenGC @EnvAgencySW That's serious in terms of sea defence as we enter the winter storm season but the real question is why did the very expensive new sea defences fail so spectacularly?

urls.title: Sign up for flood warnings
urls.description: Register your home or business in England, Scotland or Wales to receive flood warnings and find out how to check flood risk in Northern Ireland

tweets.text:
As we head further into Winter #beprepared and check your #flood risk now. Sign up to get warnings in England by phone, email or text message if your home or business is at risk of flooding. The service is free. 
https://t.co/4RNmEplRO4 @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/Xhpp2wNH9t

Great to see #TeamEA trialing #zero emmision technology in the form of this fully #electric mini digger from @JCBmachines The @EnvAgency has got ambitious targets to reduce our #environmental impact with the aim to be a net carbon zero organisation by 2030 https://t.co/k9IwS4Chwn https://t.co/vxikZdk42b

tweets.text: @PaulReevesEA @Drainsids @EnvAgencyMids What tonnage has been cleared upto now
@PaulReevesEA @Drainsids @EnvAgencyMids Is that a spirally wound liner within the existing culvert ? If not what pipe material? Unusual mass root intrusion- is it via a lateral connection?

You never know what you are going to find when doing #CCTV surveys of culverts! This mass of tree roots was located by our contractors @drainsIDS during a camera survey today on the #Hemington Brook #Leicestershire. This will be a challenge to remove. #floodrisk #winterreadiness https://t.co/Op9EoQl7Le
The poor Gaywood River doesn't have a chance at the moment, bleeding from dredged ditches, suspected sewage fungus, dead bait and hooks left to trap wildlife... https://t.co/B9CPf40FkK

Even now we are now back in #lockdown2, our essential #winterreadiness work continues and our contractors @Drainsids are still hard at work in #Hemington #Leicestershire. There is a staggering amount of silt in places, that is being removed to reduce #floodrisk in the village. https://t.co/OHOnjC42RL

tweets.text: @PaulReevesEA @Drainsids @EnvAgencyMids All the more reason to keep surface water and watercourses on the surface!

Great working with @WildTroutTrust and Dorset Arms Angling Club to support our native #trout in the #Eridge Stream, which flows into the River #Medway. Adding gravel provides spawning grounds for other fish too and benefits invertebrates AND encourages plant growth!
@Nus_Ghani https://t.co/t10CZHq0zw
